work.summary: Have been contributing to several freelance web development projects and client feedback has been nothing but positive.

Worked with a team of PC and Apple techs in the Service and Repair center of this consumer electronics store. This was a fast-paced, high-volume repair shop so documenting every repair step in a database was essential to keeping things running smoothly.

My primary responsibility was connecting with schools and businesses to sell refurbished computers and electronics.  However, sales is not one of my strong points so most of my efforts went towards setting up an ecommerce site.

I joined as a bench technician at a time the company was growing quickly and the need for a full-time technical support position just became necessary. I soon became a huge value to the company with The need soon came for a full-time Technical Support position and, as the most knowledgeable technician, I was quickly promoted the role.
highlights: Learned very quickly to Google first before asking questions

publications.name: EduPages
publications.summary: College Directory built from publically avaiable data.

publications.name: Bright Ideas
publications.summary: Web app that allows users to post and like idea’s and see who else liked an idea. Created database along with controllers, repositories, and models for a fully functional app within 4 hours for the Coding Dojo Java/Spring belt exam. Tech – JavaScript, Python, React.JS, Redux, Flow, Django

publications.name: Survey App
publications.summary: Web app that allows users to create and take single question surveys. Created database along with controllers and front­end for a fully functional app within 4 hours for the Coding Dojo MEAN belt exam. Tech – JavaScript, Mongoose.js, Express.js, Angular 4, Node.js
